indication: Atrial fibrillation, assessment for carotid stenosis, stroke risk stratification
technique: Gray-scale, color flow, and spectral Doppler evaluation of the extracranial carotid arteries and vertebral arteries was performed bilaterally.

rightCarotid.cca: Normal caliber and flow. IMT 0.9 mm.
rightCarotid.ica: Mild heterogeneous plaque at the origin. Peak systolic velocity 98 cm/s. End diastolic velocity 32 cm/s. ICA/CCA ratio 1.4. Estimated stenosis <50%.

leftCarotid.cca: Normal caliber and flow. IMT 0.8 mm.
leftCarotid.ica: Minimal calcified plaque at the bulb. Peak systolic velocity 85 cm/s. End diastolic velocity 28 cm/s. ICA/CCA ratio 1.2. Estimated stenosis <50%.

findings.vertebralArteries: Bilateral vertebral arteries demonstrate antegrade flow.

impression: Bilateral mild carotid atherosclerosis with estimated <50% stenosis of both internal carotid arteries.
Recommend continued medical management with anticoagulation for atrial fibrillation.
Follow-up carotid ultrasound in 1-2 years given underlying atherosclerosis.
